text.content:
Whenever a character is able to select an archetype feat, they can select manafont archetype feats. Like regular archetypes, the feat selection provided can give the characters mechanical and thematic focuses in developing their characters.  In general, manafont archetype feats tend to emphasize use of focus points and their manafont features in specific ways. 

Selecting a manafont archetype is significant enough that it behaves similarly to a class archetype in that it is a decision made at 1st level, even though it may not alter the class the way a class archetype would. As a result, it restricts the character from selecting any other manafont or class archetypes. When characters select a manafont archetype, they must take the dedication for that archetype at 1st or 2nd level.

Finally, upon selecting a manafont archetype, a character gains the Cast a Spell activity, and any time a character gains a focus spell, they gain a focus point.

Amongst those who walk with nature, there are some who ponder their greater place in the cosmos of all life. The Sojourner is a believer of nature and its core elements, seeking union with the great harmony. They pursue the wisdom of the bending river of all life with great zeal, and fight valiantly to protect it as if they were part of its core. They travel and fight alongside chosen stalwart companions, journeying together to be part of the circle of life.

Additional Feats: 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.cg816q76S5otM7yD]{Animal Empathy}; 10th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.3R09Hl6IDMgPcSs0]{Beastmaster Bond}; 12th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.j5Xjr8vZuBhCixIr]{Side by Side} (12th); 16th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Aeea44xyJqYArFun]{Lead the Pack}
